title: Bug 113047: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
OB:
When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children node listing is not displayed. Following the steps below: 

1. Create a new data set without providing an SQL statement.
2. The new data source should not have any database/table/column information.

Actual result: After changing the data source, there is no child node listing in the data set editor page of the query tab. This issue persists even after closing and reopening the data set editor.
SR:
To reproduce: 

1. Create a new data set without providing an SQL statement.
2. Ensure that the new data source does not have any database/table/column information.
3. Change the data source for the data set.
4. Check the data set editor page of the query tab for the presence of the children node listing.
